attributes.action: Free blood tests for people putting themselves forward as Living Donors.
attributes.background:
If someone is willing to be a Living Donor, undergo invasive surgery to change peoples lives, and at the same time save the NHS money - surely, we can provide them a blood group certificate on the NHS and not ask them to pay for it? 
It's a selfless act, & being forced to go private is prohibitive.
attributes.additional_details:
I've lived with CKD for ten years, and now I am in need of a transplant or face years of dialysis. I am so lucky that a group of people have come forward as potential Living Donors.

These people are willing to undergo invasive surgery to change lives. This surgery would also save the NHS millions, transplanting kidneys is more cost efficient than dialysis. 

It's the principle - if someone is willing to undertake such a selfless act, as a society let's not ask them to pay for the privilege.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for alcoholic drinks to display it's nutritional information
attributes.background: It is the law to display nutritional information on all food and drink except for alcoholic drinks. Many people use this information for any dietary issues they may have, from a simple diet to type 1 diabetes. Without nutritional information it is impossible to consume alcohol for some people.
attributes.additional_details: Alcohol is extremely calorific and I believe people would change their views on how much they drink if they knew what was in what they drink. Also being diabetic myself, I have to use insulin depending on how much carbohydrate I consume, which is impossible to know with alcohol, and could pose and extremely dangerous health risk.

attributes.action: Allow Doctors to Issue Temporary Disabled Parking Badges
attributes.background: Many people leave hospital and are vulnerable and have extremely limited mobility. I believe GPs and Doctors should be able to issue temporary Disabled Parking Badges to help people with temporary issues
attributes.additional_details:
Many people leave hospital have had invasive or life changing surgery and are signed off work for weeks or even moths to recover. During this time no provision is made to help them access shops, pharmacists or even hospitals!

I would like to empower Doctors to issue temporary Disabled Parking Badges to help post operative patients rehabilitate.

These badges would give the bearer the same access rights as the current Disabled Badge scheme however they would expire as patients recover.

attributes.action: Outlaw mobile safety cameras or prove they improve road safety
attributes.background: Mobile safety cameras or mobile speed cameras, they appear in places with no warnings to motorists, fine if you're not speeding but prove that they are improving road safety! Where I live accidents are minimal we have no speed cameras just the van that shows up and no warning signs before you see it
attributes.additional_details: It's about time a proper debate was had about these! If they are just to target those who pay no attention place a sign before it can target a motorist let them know there is a police operation in progress! Show is proof that they actually improve road safety and reduce accidents in areas they are used! Modern technology on cars does though that has been proven time and time again! Raise speed limits of you are to continue to use these cash cows or give plausible warnings that they are in action

attributes.action:
Make large corporations with "off shore" activity pay a 30% 
UK operating tax.
attributes.background: Corporations that operate in the UK can legally get away with out paying any tax to the state by going through various loop holes in the system. So we are calling for OUR government, people that we have put in place to work for US, we the people to charge these companies a UK operating tax of 30%
attributes.additional_details: The rate of 30% is to be paid from profits of said company and will be estimated by the government and checked with the companies own accounts and billed to the off shore company. (Much like when the HMRC decides how much tax a UK citizen should have paid if there is any discrepancy in end of year  accounts.)  If the company disagrees then they will be served a notice to close all remaining branches and leave the country.

attributes.action: Ban mobile phones in the House
attributes.background: After seeing the reactions to the call for George Osborne to apologise all we can see from the Tory front bench is laughing at their mobile phones and texting. The use of mobile phones at work is generally banned and I think the same rule should stand in Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ygQykstDk2w

attributes.action: Scrap 20% VAT on memorial headstones and the service provided by memorial masons
attributes.background:
Recently my 5 year daughter 'fell asleep' and i was shocked to find out that VAT is applied on memorial headstones ,memorial vases etc. 
How is VAT allowed in the first place, could someone explain to me how its a value added tax when you lose someone suddenly and unexpectedly.
attributes.additional_details: Currently charities and faith groups are allowed to claim back VAT through the Memorial Grant Scheme so can this not be opened up to the general public or VAT not applied or together.

attributes.action: Make sure refugees and immigrants are vaccinated to the same standard as uk
attributes.background: We are now seeing cases of bugs and diseases that's not been an issue for years in UK. Our children are starting to suffer for longer periods and more often. As a parent I'm getting concerned about about my children's health and have a 3 year old that's constantly getting ill
attributes.additional_details: As the country is allowing refugees and immigrants from various locations it's time to think of our children's health welfare and theirs. We need to ensure our children don't pick up various bugs that have become less common in the last 20 years or so. Please support us to petition the government to ensure all new British citizens are given vaccinations up to the level that we all are

attributes.action: Admit all children with a British connection to the UK from the French camps.
attributes.background: The clearance policy agreed by French courts and the French government's use of water cannon in executing it in these weather conditions, is against common humanity.

attributes.action: Make David Cameron personally fund his folly trips within the EU
attributes.background: David Cameron is going back and forth to various meetings with various leaders to argue for reform but the have all refused the terms set out by our Prime Minister.  It won't happen!  At least make him pay for his and his entourage travel, accommodation and food personally from his own resources.

attributes.action: Introduce a "Trading Standards" body for politicians
attributes.background: Politicians supporting the "Leave" and "Remain" EU campaigns are now backing down from their campaign claims and promises, with no punishment. A member of the public providing misleading sales information would be subjected to fines/imprisonment. We want politicians to be subject to the same rules.
attributes.additional_details: We want an independent body to hold politicians to account.  This body should have the power to impose personal sanctions for misleading statements. These sanctions should be unlimited fines and imprisonment as can currently be imposed by Trading Standards on members of the public.  The punishment should reflect the scale and impact of the misleading statement.

attributes.action: Ban pre packed cooked bones being sold as dog treats
attributes.background:
Many dog owners are unaware of the dangers of giving their dog cooked bones. 
Lots of shops in the uk (not just pet shops) sell pre packed cooked bones as dog treats which are sold to dog owners everyday! Cooked bones can be deadly to dogs and many die every year because of this

attributes.action: Disapprove plans to frack in North Yorkshire
attributes.background: Plans to frack just half a mile from the picturesque North Yorkshire village have been approved by North Yorkshire County Council, despite 4000-strong opposition. This isn't ruling on popular opinion; instead this is elitism and these plans have to be disapproved, for the safety of the local people.
attributes.additional_details: Campaigners have reacted with fury and dismay after North Yorkshire county councillors approved plans to carry out hydraulic fracturing at Kirby Misperton, near Malton. The eleven-member Planning Committee voted 7 votes to 4 to grant planning permission to Third Energy to frack just ½ mile from the picturesque North Yorkshire village. Over 1,000 people attended an anti-fracking rally outside the meeting at County Hall on Friday 20th at Northallerton, but to no avail.

attributes.action: Ban the use of neonicotinoids in the UK
attributes.background: 37 MILLION BEES (600 HIVES) FOUND DEAD AFTER PLANTING LARGE GMO CORN FIELD TREATED WITH NEONICOTINOID CLASS OF PESTICIDES IN CANADA.
attributes.additional_details: http://jbanews.com/2016/02/27/37-million-bees-found-dead-after-planting-large-gmo-corn-field-treated-with-neonicotinoid-class-of-pesticides/

attributes.action: TRADE DEAL with EU after BREXIT must prohibit unrestricted immigration
attributes.background:
We are told it may take10 years to negotiate a deal with the EU after we vote to leave. NO - Draft the deal now. 

Give them some great trading terms.  However, it MUST NOT be in return for the same unrestricted immigration as we have now and we must not be required to pay them money for nothing.
attributes.additional_details:
You must listen to the population of this country and if we have voted to leave it will be because.....

1) We want to limit the people that arrive in the UK from around the world based on a fair system we can control.

2) We do not want to be a net contributor to the EU or anywhere for that matter. We want our billions spent in the UK.

3) We want to make our own laws, which is what generations of British people have fought and died for over the centuries.

You are hereby tasked with delivery

attributes.action: Introduce self defence into the national curriculum
attributes.background: I propose introducing classes where students learn techniques such as disarming an attacker and how to get out of holds, as this knowledge could one day save their life. I think this would be best incorporated into primary schools so we can learn this from a young age.
attributes.additional_details:
In the UK in 2015, there were 700 000 attacks and 24 043 rapes. At least half of these could have had a less brutal outcome had the victim had a good level of self defence knowledge. For example, in 2012 in Manchester, a 22 year old lady was able to fight off her attacker as she had her own martial arts school and so was able to respond effectively.
My own brother, having been verbally and physically bullied for four years, was able to put a stop to it by taking up kickboxing.

attributes.action: A Gen Election before Article 50, free of first past the post for EU membership.
attributes.background:
We dispute the EU referendum result; due to numbers against and that the Leave Campaign substantially misled the Electorate.  

Both Conservatives and Labour have promised to enforce the vote.  This promise blocks at least 48% of the Electorate from revisiting this issue in elections due (cont)
attributes.additional_details:
(cont) to the first past the post rule violating almost half of the UK’s democratic rights.

We demand a general election free of the first past the post rule to determine EU membership prior to invoking Article 50, so as to give the maximum number of the British people a voice in their country's future.

http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/26/eu-referendum-brexit-vote-leave-iain-duncan-smith-nhs

Cameron and Corbyn are on record as respecting the referendum result to exit the EU.

attributes.action: Establish a constitutional convention
attributes.background: The UK has no written constitution. We also have a highly undemocratic voting system which consistently results in one party getting majority control with a minority of votes. We need a constitutional convention to address this and other issues like the House of Lords and leaving the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Local and parliamentary elections are undemocratic as voters do not get the result they voted for overall, due to the first past the post voting system. The House of Lords is entirely appointed. We have incomplete devolution and our legislature is not set up to deal with this satisfactorily. We need a constitutional convention to address these issues and draft a written constitution. With our exit from the EU having so much impact, this is the perfect time for this initiative.

attributes.action: Simplify the motorcycle test
attributes.background: Since the implementation of directive 2006/126/EEC the UK motorcycle test has become unnecessarily complicated and prohibitively expensive.
attributes.additional_details: The closed circuit part of the test that ensures riding at 50 KMH is totally irrelevant. We wish to see a structured sensible test similar to the previous test that provided safe training and restricted access to powerful bikes for a short period as we believe this was the most successful version of motorcycle testing. We believe that structured training is preferable to complicated legislation as a way to reduce accidents.

attributes.action: Introduce Helen’s Law where hiding a body becomes a criminal offence
attributes.background: To lose a loved one to murder is horrific. To be denied their funeral causes unimaginable suffering. Ian Simms is serving a life sentence for the murder of  Helen McCourt, aged 22, on 9 February 1988, in Billinge, Lancs. Simms has always refused to reveal the whereabouts of Helen’s body.
attributes.additional_details:
The case made legal history as only the third ever UK murder trial without a body and was one of the first in the UK to use DNA fingerprinting.

As it currently stands, the English legal system does not require a convicted murderer to admit guilt or reveal the location of a victim’s remains before being released. 

We hereby ask the government to acknowledge the pain and distress caused to the families of missing murder victims by:
1. Denying parole to murderers for as long as they refuse to disclose the whereabouts of their victim’s remains
2. Passing a full life tariff (denying parole or release) until the murderer discloses the location (and enables the recovery) of their victim’s remains

Denying a funeral is, surely, an infringement of basic human rights.

attributes.action: Introduce a Bank Holiday for St. George's and St. David's Day
attributes.background: Since 1903 Ireland/Northern Ireland have had a Bank Holiday for St. Patrick's Day and since 2007 Scotland have had a Bank Holiday for St. Andrew's Day, however England and Wales unlike the rest of the United Kingdom do not have a Bank Holiday for their respective Patron Saint's Day.
attributes.additional_details:
The reference below shows the enactment of the Scotland Act 2007. http://www.legislation.gov.uk/asp/2007/2/introduction/enacted
England and Wales have 8 public holidays a year which is less than any other G20 country, Scotland have 9 which is equal to the number of German Public Holiday's. http://www.onrec.com/news/statistics-and-trends/uk-has-lowest-number-of-public-holidays-within-g20
Is it time for the UK to bring itself into line with the rest of the world when it comes to Public Holidays?

attributes.action: Enforce senior drivers to re-take their driving test
attributes.background: Lots of senior drivers didn't have to sit a formal driving test and even more didn't have to sit one that was adequate. It should be a legal requirement for drivers at the age of 70 to re-sit a upto date driving test that they desperately need. This would improve the safety of roads in general

attributes.action: Patient centered treatment for pernicious anemia/ b12 injections.
attributes.background: People with b12 deficiency have quarterly b12 injections most patients feel this is not regular enough and despite asking doctors you have to wait 3 months and have to feel the ill effects this gives people, which is linked to a lot of further health problems.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-2191161/The-60p-injection-boost-flagging-energy.html

attributes.action: Give Ofcom legally enforceable powers for customer service of telecom companies.
attributes.background: Ofcom do not have legal powers to either monitor customer service standards, or take action against telecom companies that fail to provide acceptable service levels to their customers. This may be slow Broadband speeds, or simply failing to have adequately staffed help lines or technical support.
attributes.additional_details: There are many incidences of poor service provision by Telecom companies. Recently this has been featured on a popular televison news programme in the East of the country.  They stated that they had been inundated with complaints.

attributes.action: Adopt a zero tolerance approach to acts of racism, in the wake of the referendum
attributes.background: Since the EU referendum, there have been numerous accounts of racism and xenophobia, where people who are in the UK legally are being abused, assaulted and/or told to "go home". A zero tolerance stance is required to show that racism and xenophobia has no place in the UK, whether in the EU or not.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/eu-referendum-racism_uk_576fe161e4b08d2c56396075

attributes.action: Ban takeaways from using Non-Recyclable Polystyrene boxes & packaging for food.
attributes.background: In recent years there has been a concentrated focus on recycling. We are encouraged to recycle wherever possible, yet most takeaways/restaurants have shifted from using recyclable packaging (paper/card) to non recyclable polystyrene. Petition is to make them use recyclable packaging only.

attributes.action: Reduce Foreign Aid - divert to, Health, Police, Military, and Pensioners
attributes.background: Foreign aid 11 billion budget to increase by £1 billion (That is money the UK Government borrows to give away).The UK  spends more than any other country and is the second largest aid donor in the world (The Telegraph)  Despite in 2015 UK government debt amounted to £1.56 trillion(economicshelp.org)
attributes.additional_details:
In January, it emerged that civil servants had gone on a £1billion spending spree over eight weeks last year to hit the government target of allocating 0.7 per cent of national income to overseas aid.
BRITAIN's spending on foreign aid will be LARGER than the entire Home Office budget in each of the next five years - reaching a staggering £16BILLION, it was revealed. Pakistan who is a Nuclear Power and not so long ago bought a fleet of fighters off the USA get the highest amount 351 million.

attributes.action: Abolish the puppy trade
attributes.background: Recently seen visual images regarding how dogs are held captive and bread in small cages in order to be sold on the high street. Dogs should not be sold or treated this way. I want action because animal cruelty should not be acceptable in any circumstances.
attributes.additional_details: A recent documentary by the BBC called 'Britain's Puppy Dealers: exposed' illustrated real examples of dog dealers and how dogs and puppies are left in small cages without heat, food or any air holes, and how small puppies were dumped on the side of the road because they were either dead or not up to standard. This type of evidence illustrates why this needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: Bring Leasehold Housing into the Commonhold and Leasehold Reform Act 2002
attributes.background: There is a gap within the legislation to protect Leasehold Housing in the same way that leasehold flats are protected. Without that protection, management companies & maintenance companies can abuse the current system. House buyers need to be protected against escalating and unreasonable fees!
attributes.additional_details: If Leasehold Housing were brought into the current legislation leaseholders could gather together & form a committee and have the option to change the company or a Right to Manage. If Leasehold Housing stays outside the parameters of this legislation the only option leaseholders have is to go to a tribunal to challenge charges & if found guilty the company still cannot be replaced.Protection is required to regulate leasehold housing especially as many sites are now building on a leasehold basis.

attributes.action: Gerard Batten, to lead the delegation negotiating terms for leaving the EU
attributes.background: Before I decided on this petition I spoke to five Conservative friends and three Socialist friends who were all for Leaving, and they said they could support my idea.
attributes.additional_details:
There are huge pitfalls if the Leave campaign wins the referendum. Article50 is the worst, the Norwegian and Swiss options are not necessary for the fifth strongest economy in the world.

Mr Batten has written an excellent book ”The Road to Freedom: How Britain Can Escape the EU” showing the traps and tricks that Article50 invokes so that we could be kept in each 'two year period' indefinitely. As Nigel Farage is a little like Marmite (people either love him or hate him) Mr Batten would be an ideal replacement.

attributes.action: Make Fibre Optic Broadband a legal right in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Despite the 'Superfast Britain' initiative, many are still in the relative dark-ages when it comes to internet speed. No consideration has been made for those placed in very rural zones. Make fibre optic broadband a legal right in the UK and force providers to give the service we pay for.
attributes.additional_details: Many of us pay extortionately more money for a service which is unreliable and slow, simply due to where we choose to live. For example, being in a ONE MILE exclusion zone means we will never have internet speeds over 3-5MB per second. In larger households, especially families, this means the internet is unusable due to the global initiative towards movie streaming, gaming, and downloading. Without forcing the providers to provide the service, they will continue to overcharge and under deliver.

attributes.action: Make the production and sale of marijuana legal in UK
attributes.background: Prohibition on marijuana in the UK has gone on for too long. For 88 years innocent civilians have had to break the law if they wanted to partake in a statistically less harmful substance than cigarettes or alcohol which kill over 100,000 people yearly. England has a chance to get ahead of the curve.
attributes.additional_details: Legal Marijuana sale/use is on the cusp of becoming a reality in the US. This petition may not lead to decriminalisation of marijuana, but we all know it's going to happen within the next 5 - 10 years. So why imprison these innocent people for a longer period of time, just decriminalise it now! Crime will go down statistically. And the amount of revenue the government would make on tax is such an untapped market just waiting for the right structure to be put in place. Make it happen. 2016 Legal

attributes.action: Extend the Freedom of Information Act 2000
attributes.background: Amend the FoI Act to stop Ministers blocking FoI requests; to limit the time allowed for public authorities to respond to requests; to extend the FoI Act to cover private companies, social enterprises & charities which carry out work for public authorities; & the Monarchy.

attributes.action: Bring back A-level resits!
attributes.background: We want to bring back A-level resits for alll students across the UK. We want to be able to make sure you can resit your AS year and/or A2 year. It will enable students to have access to a second opportunity and allow them to attend University instead of missing out on the chance to prevail in life.
attributes.additional_details: By bringing back the AS/A2 resits, students will have the opportunity to achieve their highest aspirations in life instead of being set back due to one bad grade.

attributes.action: Give Every Woman The Right To Become A Mother Through IVF On The NHS.
attributes.background: In 2012, we lost our baby at 20 weeks pregnant. After being under a consultant on the NHS for 2 years in November 2015 we were told because my husband has 2 children they can't do anymore for us. All I want is to be a mother due to having endometriosis falling pregnant naturally is difficult.
attributes.additional_details:
IVF on the NHS 
NHS trusts across England and Wales are working to provide the same levels of service. However, the provision of IVF treatment varies across the country and often depends on local CCG policies. 

CCGs may have additional criteria you need to meet before you can have IVF on the NHS, such as:
•not having any children already, from both your current and any previous relationships 
•being a healthy weight 
•not smoking 
•falling into a certain age range

attributes.action: Recognition of the Armenian Genocide
attributes.background: I would like HM Government to recognise the events that overtook the Armenian population [of what is now E Turkey] around 1915 as 'genocide'. HM Government to follow the lead of EU partners - such as France & Austria - who already recognise those events as 'genocide'.
attributes.additional_details:
As part of a parliamentary discussion, MPs should consider whether the terrible Jewish holocaust/genocide differs from that which overtook the Armenia population [of E Turkey] around 1915. Nearly two million innocent people were killed during those events.

Furthermore, why, since the Jewish genocide has been officially recognised by HM Government, is it the case that the Armenian genocide remains unacknowledged - given the criteria set down in the 1942 UN declaration on Genocide?

attributes.action: Help Britain's homeless find shelter instead of moving them on all the time.
attributes.background: There are far too many homeless people on the streets of Britain, many of them have had unfortunate events which lead up to them finding themselves on the streets. They should be given help and assistance in finding accommodation instead of being moved on and looked down on. Please sign and help.
attributes.additional_details: Our local council keep moving the local homeless guys on, instead of spending money doing this why can't the fund a hostel or something locally for these guys to go to.

attributes.action: Establish a National Museum of Film and Photography in Bradford
attributes.background: Film and Photography span the sciences and the arts in the breadth of their contribution to society. A National Museum is needed to document  this from its start in 19th century to its continuing powerful role in the visual age of the 21st century.
attributes.additional_details: The recent decision by the SMG to pass photographic collections to the V&A highlights the absence of a focus by any National Museum on  Photography and Film, and the way in which these disciplines and their roles span across arts and science in documenting society, industry, technology, biography as well as being areas of technological advancement and artistic endeavour.

attributes.action: Make primary/high schools stagger half terms making family holidays affordable
attributes.background: I believe that family holidays should be a given right for every child, childhood memories that are achievable for every family regardless of age, race or social status. If schools were to stagger the half term holidays this would give families flexibility to enable them to book affordable holidays
attributes.additional_details: I come from a modest hard working family who gave me and my sister a holiday every year usually with extended family. These are precious memories and are experiences that have contributed towards making me the hard working single mother I am today. I work hard and save to take my children to see different places in the world, my son is 9yrs old he is now keen to go on to study geography. His dream is to visit every continent before he is 21. I would like to help him with this dream but it is difficult without getting myself into debt, incurring fines and/or the stigma that is forced upon parents like me because of the current regulations.

attributes.action: Provide funding for a specialist music teacher in every primary school.
attributes.background: The racism and xenophobia surrounding the EU Referendum has demonstrated the need for better music education in our schools in order to teach our children about other cultures, create safe spaces where children feel a sense of well-being, joy, togetherness and purpose.
attributes.additional_details: Primary schools often don't have a specialist; budgets are squeezed. Music stimulates cognitive development, enhancing everything from language to mathematics and empathy; it helps children to succeed at school and far into adulthood. The younger we learn the better. The experience of music allows children to build human understanding across differences of ​culture, creed, and race. Music-making builds a happy society: you make friends in choirs and orchestras; concerts are uplifting.

attributes.action: Prostate screening for men over 45
attributes.background: 1 in 8 men will have prostrate cancer a simple blood test would help detect early rising psa levels
attributes.additional_details: From personal experience of having prostrate cancer on discovery of very low level psa I was sent for biopsy resulting in discovery of 2 tumours which meant I had to have a prostatectomy

attributes.action: Allow tax-paying UK residents to vote in general elections and referendums
attributes.background:
Excluding tax paying immigrants from the voting population makes the vote less representative of the will of the UK because it silences a very important part of the engine of the country.
Let's make sure going forward all the people who love and work hard for this country have a say in its future.

attributes.action: Hold a public enquiry into the legitimacy of the result of the EU Referendum.
attributes.background: The EU Referendum vote to leave the EU will make an irreversible change to the UK’s relationship to the rest of world. Remain and Leave campaigns, and unofficial campaigns, mislead the public on key factual information about our current and future relationship with the EU and the rest of the world.
attributes.additional_details:
We have a principal in the UK that we are not allowed to gain advantage by knowingly lying. Yet that is what has happened with the EU referendum. Both campaigns made statements that were not true.

The Leave campaign has achieved a narrow victory and we are now told that their main campaign promise “We send the EU £350 million a week let’s fund the NHS instead” is not possible.

We need an enquiry into the legitimacy of the result that is based on lies  by both campaigns to acquire support.

attributes.action: Make ABP and other former public sector bodies protect historic buildings.
attributes.background: Grimsby was once the largest fishing port in the world.  Associated British Ports (ABP) is demolishing the 19th century buildings at the heart of the historic port of Grimsby.  ABP have permitted development rights - no planning application is needed.
attributes.additional_details: ABP was formerly the British Transport Docks Board.  Other industries formerly in the public sector have legal duties to consider historic buildings (e.g. in Water Industry Act 1991, section 3 and Electricity Act 1989, Schedule 9).  The law should be changed so that ABP (and other bodies formerly in the public sector) are subject to similar duties.

attributes.action: All Public & Committee meetings in Council & Government should be Live-Streamed
attributes.background: To further the interests of transparency and openness, a presumption should be made to Live-Stream all meetings that affect people's lives, so no official or elected representative can hide behind anonymity and we, as citizens, will no longer be deceived or have communications  "spun".
attributes.additional_details: Where there is no risk of compromise to individuals or families, the presumption must be that all public or committee meetings should be live-streamed so citizens have less reason to distrust politicians or civil servants. If there is nothing to hide, there is nothing to fear is what we are told by government agencies concerned with surveillance and monitoring, so the same should apply to government. The United Kingdom should be a world leader in "glasnost" not forever in the shadows.

attributes.action: Include all armed services veterans on the 2021 census
attributes.background: Our armed services form a historical and vital part of our community. Although the service records are there we just do not know how many veterans are still with us or where. This would help the Government to plan and possibly allocate resources to areas with a high veteran population.
attributes.additional_details: By including veterans into the census this would bring to the veterans a sense that they are really valued by us all.

attributes.action: Offer financial support for students who have had to defer for medical reasons.
attributes.background: If a full time university student has to defer the course due to medical reasons, there are no provisions in place to prevent them from becoming homeless or to access financial support. Many students defer each year and are forced to give up their education in order to claim state benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
Department for Work and Pensions regulations do not consider deferred students, even if they are signed off sick by their GP. 

Housing benefit do not consider deferred students even if they have dependent children. 

Student Finance England can only provide up to 60 days worth of funding if you provide adequate evidence for the reason why you've had to defer. 

Universities have grants for those in hardship but have a yearly allowance. You cannot go over this limit under any circumstances.

attributes.action: Rename the RRS Sir David Attenborough to RRS Boaty McBoatface
attributes.background: Britain is known worldwide for both it's excellent scientific research and sense of humour. NERC should accept the choice of RRS Boaty McBoatface (124,109 votes), rather than for RRS Sir David Attenborough (10,284 votes) and respect the true democratic result and excellent British wit.

attributes.action: Limit paying out Child Benefit to the first two children only.
attributes.background:
As the law stands, Child Benefit can be paid out to people who have children. This may or may not be the parents.
The payment for the first child is currently £20.70
For each additional child, it is £13.70 per child.
We believe that Child Benefit should be limited to the first two children only.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that benefits are in the gift of the Government.
As the law currently stands, Child Benefit is paid at the rate of £20.70 for the first child and £13.70 for each additional child.
We believe that this needs to change and that the Government should legislate to limit the payout of Child Benefit to the first two children only.
This would reduce the benefits bill and the burden on the taxpayers.
People who wish to have more than two children should not expect the state to pay for them.

attributes.action: Train all cyclist's to use the roads safely.
attributes.background: Cyclists are vulnerable road users but don't help themselves. Cyclists should have to take a theory test, cycling test, a type of registration plate, made to wear safety equipment, have insurance and a certificate to say their bike is road worthy!
attributes.additional_details: Cyclists jumping red lights is dangerous, not having correctly working brakes, dangerous and lack of understanding also dangerous, I could go on and on. The number of cyclists is increasing, so is the rate of accidents. Too many ride at night with no lights, if cars did that, we'd get pulled in.... Make the roads safer and fairer for all road users. What person in their right mind would go down the left side of a lorry that's turning left? Training would help and create jobs!
